content: vivaldi summer mitts vivaldi summer mitts is the second pair of mitts in the four seasons collection a cool meandering stream winds down the back of the hand with stockinette on the palm the lace pattern is rhythmic and easy to memorize it is written for magic loop but could easily be adapted for dpns please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 to determine your size wrap a flexible measuring tape around your hand below the knuckles excluding your thumb sizes tiny 7 0 smallish 7 5 larger 8 0 materials tiny fingering yarn 150 200 yards us 2 2 75mm circular needle 32 inches smallish sport/dk yarn 150 200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle 32 inches larger worsted yarn 150 200 yards us 6 4 0mm circular needle 32 inches notions 1 locking stitch marker 1 additional marker waste yarn and tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations co - cast on using the backward loop method k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop p - purl pm - place marker lt - *left twist rt - *right twist sm - slip marker sts - stitches *purl soho has a great tutorial for left and right twist https //www purlsoho com/create/right-and-left-twist/ this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 right mitt twisted rib cuff cast on 48 sts using a stretchy cast on method and divide evenly onto needle 1 and needle 2 being careful not to twist prepare to join and work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round k1tbl p1 for 10 rounds right wrist work rows1 - 23 of lace chart lace encircles the entire wrist so row 1 - 23 are each worked twice once per needle 1 & needle 2 right hand/thumb from this point forward the back of the hand needle 1 is worked from lace chart row 24 -
